intro: Espeletia petiolata f. corymbosa, commonly known as the "Corymbous Espeletia," is a flowering plant native to the high-altitude regions of South America, particularly in the Andes. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant is distinguished by its dense, woolly foliage and clusters of small, showy flowers that bloom in the summer months. It thrives in rocky, well-drained soils and is adapted to the harsh conditions of its high-altitude habitat. This species is often found in cloud forests and paramo ecosystems, where it plays a role in local biodiversity.
